The star class

Test

This class is the main data structure of this package. it represents an initially unclassified YSO to which the standard classification is applied to.

class classify.classify.star(source: Row)

Star class.

The star class is used to determine the infrared alpha index of a young stellar object (YSO).

srcID

The unique source identifier of the YSO (from input catalog).

Type:

int

ra

Right Ascension of the YSO.

Type:

float

dec

Declination of the YOS

Type:

float

alpha

Dictionary containing the alpha indices calculated for this YSO

Type:

dict

intercept

Dictionary holding the intercepts of the line fits. These can be used to plot the fitted line to the SED of the YSO.

Type:

dict

intercept_n

Dictionary holding the intercepts from the alternative alpha index method.

Type:

dict

cls

Dictionary holding the determined observational class of the YSO.

Type:

dict

fluxNames

A list containing the names of the flux columns from the input catalog.

Type:

list

fluxErrNames

A list containing the names of the flux error columns from the input catalog.

Type:

list

lambdaNames

A list containing the names of the wavelength columns from the input catalog.

Type:

list
